definition: careless/reckless/casually/absent-mindedly/at will/at random/any old how
surname Hu
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
beard/mustache/whiskers
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
first Manchu invasion of Korea (1627)
second Manchu invasion of Korea (1636)

sentences.english: I asked her for the dictionary she borrowed from me, but she just fobbed me off with a stupid excuse.
sentences.chinese: 借我的字典还给我，她却胡乱找个借口把我搪塞过去。

sentences.english: He perfunctorily thrusts the things into his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 他胡乱地把那些东西塞到口袋里。

sentences.english: He was thrown roughly into a bed where he remained untended for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他被胡乱地扔到一张床上，好久也没有人护理他。

sentences.english: Some of the bodies were sprawled on the ground or in their vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 一些尸体被胡乱地扔在地上或他们的车里。

sentences.english: Dogs eat the darndest things. From fish hooks to spoons, MY DOG ATE WHAT?
sentences.chinese: 狗狗最爱胡乱地把东西吞下，包括从鱼钩到汤匙。

sentences.english: It is incredible how parents and children never let go of old habits of relating.
sentences.chinese: 难以置信，家长和孩子还是由胡乱联系的老毛病。

sentences.english: But I'll make no more ado, I'll go boldly and look.
sentences.chinese: 但我也不要再胡乱猜测了，我要大胆地进去看看。

sentences.english: He huddled his books in the corner of his bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 他把书胡乱堆积在他卧室的一角。

sentences.english: He started flailing around and hitting Vincent in the chest.
sentences.chinese: 他的手臂开始胡乱挥舞起来，打在了文森特胸口上。

sentences.english: I shoved my text books into my bag and followed Rabbit out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 我胡乱把书往书包里一扔，紧随着兔子走出教室。

sentences.english: The minutes ticked by. Bob scribbled away on the pad.
sentences.chinese: 而鲍勃呢，胡乱的在便签纸上写着什么。

sentences.english: Xiao Lun's heart is beating hard in a random rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 小伦的心胡乱地跳了起来。

sentences.english: We don't know how to deal with the inferiority and jettison to others.
sentences.chinese: 不知如何把自卑处理，便胡乱投弃到他人身上。

sentences.english: I always praise people who can save their money and not spend too much.
sentences.chinese: 我总是很赞赏那些节约钱财并且从不胡乱花消的人。

sentences.english: Malinvestment is the curse of artificial booms.
sentences.chinese: 胡乱投资是虚假繁荣的诅咒。

definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
as one wishes/according to one's wishes/at will/voluntary/conscious
to let (sb do sth)/to allow/regardless of
wantonly/recklessly/willfully
at one go/at a stretch/for a period of time/forming a gang
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
chaotic/topsy turvy/a complete mess
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
to act recklessly/to mess around
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
continuously/persistently/incessantly
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
to run around all over the place
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
